Message.Title: My laptop shopping experience
Message.Msg: I bought a lap top yesterday at office depot. The difference between the lenovo for $320 and the hp for $900 was marginal. You have to ask yourself how much computer do I need when a $300 laptop has more computing power than the university's entire computer network when I went to college (1985)

Message.Msg: From the Wisdom of Warren Buffet, "Buy strong companies that have taken hits" Dell is still profiting and has tons of cash. Message.Title: HP in disarray and very high debt equates to great news for Dell...
Message.Msg: If I were Michael Dell right now, I would be salivating. Contrary to media FUD, the PC business isn't going away (just longer replinishment cycles), Dell has plenty of cash surplus and non-negative media barrage to easily out maneuver HP on competitive deals, and Dell has the significant advantage of not having a new CEO every year. Lastly, Windows-8 may be adopted slowly but it will be adopted and the market looks ahead. The market/analysts will figure this all out fairly soon hence you will see a sustainable turnaround in Dell's stock. Great time to capitalize on a 'Throwing the baby out with the bath water' opportunity. Bought an initial position today. Strong support in mid 8's should it get there. DZ
